content: At AIDWA meet, she calls for nationwide movement to restore MGNREGA, stressing its role in providing livelihood security to crores of rural poor, especially women

title: Elathur constituency in Kozhikode likely to witness a three-cornered battle
content: Despite the CPI(M)‚Äôs strong grassroots presence, the seat has been allotted to the NCP within the LDF since its inception in 2008. The Congress, encouraged by gains in local body polls, is keen to contest Elathur directly this time, while the BJP‚Äôs growing presence in select pockets adds another layer of complexity

title: RTC Employees Union seeks action amid surge in attacks on on-duty drivers, conductors
content: Citing repeated assaults since the launch of the Stree Shakti scheme, union leaders demand non-bailable FIRs and warning boards to protect RTC staff

title: Anantapur‚Äôs water conservation efforts earn Prime Minister‚Äôs praise
content: He highlights how community participation and local initiative can revive even the most water-stressed regions; it reinforces the State‚Äôs commitment to water security, one of the 10 core principles under the Swarna Andhra Vision, says Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu

content: Temple town celebrates Mini Brahmotsavam as deity blesses devotees on seven vahanams from dawn to dusk

content: The courts, like other institutions, are under obligation to adhere to Constitutional norms, observes Justice (Retd.)  Sudershan Reddy; the inability to impeach a Governor for misconduct is a Constitutional vulnerability, he asserts

title: Nation honours V.S. Achuthanandan with Padma Vibhushan
content: The veteran CPI(M) leader and freedom fighter, who passed away on July 21, 2025, was a towering presence in Kerala‚Äôs political landscape for decades and a symbol of principled public life

content: State Minister for Housing, Information and Public Relations offers silk garments to the presiding deity and performs special prayers

title: Sources: Gannon agrees to become Packers DC
content: The Packers have agreed to terms with former Cardinals coach Jonathan Gannon to be their defensive coordinator, sources told ESPN.

title: Nuggets-Grizz, Mavs-Bucks ppd. by winter storm
content: NBA matchups between the Nuggets and Grizzlies as well as the Mavericks and Bucks were among the sports events postponed because of the winter storm across much of the United States.

title: Reed: Haven't yet finalized new deal with LIV
content: Patrick Reed says he is a free agent and hasn't yet finalized his contract to play in the LIV Golf League this season.

title: Arteta calls out 'poor' Arsenal after Man Utd loss
content: Mikel Arteta has challenged Arsenal to show the mental strength to win the Premier League after falling to a nervous 3-2 home defeat against Manchester United.

title: Team Penske gets 3-peat in Rolex 24 at Daytona
content: Roger Penske's team won the Rolex 24 at Daytona for a third straight year, becoming the third squad in the 64-year history of the prestigious endurance race to do so.

title: Despite lingering injury, Darnold set to face Rams
content: Seahawks quarterback Sam Darnold will start Sunday's NFC Championship Game, but he and Drew Lock split reps at practice last week due to Darnold's lingering oblique injury.

title: White: UFC 324 fight pulled for suspicious betting
content: UFC CEO Dana White confirmed a lightweight fight between Alexander Hernandez and Michael Johnson was canceled because of suspicious betting activity.

title: Aussie cyclist wins race despite kangaroo crash
content: Australia's Jay Vine was knocked down by a kangaroo on the final stage but recovered to win the Tour Down Under cycle race.

content: Who are the best quarterbacks in the 2026 class? We sized up the top 12, starting with Fernando Mendoza and Ty Simpson.

content: Seahawks quarterback Sam Darnold has struggled with turnovers against the Rams. Will Sunday be different?

content: The Pittsburgh native and former Dallas Cowboys coach will take over a team with questions starting with QB.

content: What have we learned about every team throughout the first half of 2025-26? Tim Bontemps canvasses the league.

content: Man United are 12 points behind league-leading Arsenal, but after beating the Gunners on Sunday, can the Red Devils pull off an unlikely title push?

title: Title paths for Gaethje, Pimblett and O'Malley after UFC 324
content: Justin Gaethje and Sean O'Malley picked up big wins on Saturday, but will the victories earn them a shot at undisputed glory?

title: Day 8: De Minaur dominates Bublik to reach quarters; Ukraine's Oliynykova targets Sabalenka again
content: Carlos Alcaraz and Aryna Sabalenka made light work of their fourth round opponents to advance to the quarterfinals. It wasn't so simple for top-ranked American Coco Gauff, who was made to fight deep into a deciding set against 19th-seed Karolina Muchova.

content: The good (Nebraska), not-so-good (Kentucky) and interesting (dominant freshmen) of the 2025-26 season so far.

content: Three straight losses sent the Sooners tumbling out of the top 16. They return after beating South Carolina.

content: Before New England and Denver battle to play in Super Bowl LX, here's a look back at sports and pop culture trends that dominated that last matchup.

title: How NFL players prepare for the coldest games of the year
content: Even as beards freeze and fingers lose feeling, NFL players find ways to handle ridiculously cold temperatures.

title: 'You should've never been born': How Buss family infighting drove the $10B sale of the Lakers
content: The post-Jerry Buss era was defined by resentment, dysfunction and conflict -- and ended with the loss of the most valuable family-owned franchise in the world.

title: Ranking the 100 best college football players from the 2025 season
content: Which players take the top spots? After an obvious choice at No. 1, the decisions weren't easy. Our experts tried to crack the code.

title: Predictions for rest of MLB offseason: Where will the best ace available sign? Who will make a major trade?
content: How will the rest of free agency play out? Here's what our experts think could go down between now and spring training.

title: The new Mets are better than the old Mets -- and we can prove it
content: New York will have a new look for 2026. We break down what has changed and whether the team has improved.

title: ‚ÄòInjected HIV virus into doctor‚Äô: Jealous woman attacks ex-lover‚Äôs wife
content: A chilling incident in Kurnool has sparked outrage as four people, including a nurse and her young children, face serious charges after allegedly injecting a doctor with HIV-infected blood. The attack was reportedly motivated by revenge, with the victim being the ex-wife of one of the accused, who was lured into a fabricated accident as part of the sinister plot.

title: Cruz says Navarro, Vance blocked India trade deal; mocks Trump tariffs in leaked audio
content: Senator Ted Cruz was secretly recorded criticizing Vice President JD Vance and mocking President Trump's tariff policy. Cruz warned donors that the tariffs could harm the economy and lead to Trump's impeachment, recounting a heated call with the President. He also accused Vance of being a prot√©g√© of Tucker Carlson, influencing foreign policy appointments.

title: ‚ÄòThey are stealing each other's engineers‚Äô: Yann LeCun on Google, Microsoft, Meta, OpenAI
content: AI pioneer Yann LeCun criticizes Silicon Valley's obsession with Large Language Models, calling the industry "LLM-pilled." He argues this focus stifles innovation as tech giants poach engineers, preventing diverse research. LeCun believes true artificial intelligence requires predictive "world models," a key reason for his departure from Meta to pursue this vision.

title: Why Microsoft is asking engineers to test Claude Code alongside GitHub Copilot
content: Microsoft is now having thousands of its software engineers test Anthropic's Claude Code alongside its own GitHub Copilot. This move signals growing confidence in AI coding tools, with even non-technical staff encouraged to experiment.  Nvidia's CEO also recently urged engineers to embrace AI coding assistants, highlighting a significant industry shift.

title: Former BCCI president IS Bindra passes away at 84
content: Former BCCI president and veteran cricket administrator Inderjit Singh Bindra passed away at his New Delhi residence on Sunday at the age of 84. His health deteriorated suddenly after lunch, and he died around 6.30 pm. The last rites of Bindra, a key figure in Indian cricket administration, will be performed at the Lodhi crematorium on Monday.

title: Happy Republic Day 2026: Wishes to share with friends and colleagues
content: Republic Day, celebrated annually on January 26th, commemorates India's adoption of its Constitution in 1950, marking its transition to a republic. This day honors the nation's freedom, unity, and the fundamental rights and responsibilities enshrined in its Constitution. It's a time to reflect on the values that strengthen India and encourage responsible citizenship.

title: Tiktok down: Users claim outage, just days after Tiktok 'loses' its Chinese ownership in US
content: Thousands of US users are reporting issues with the TikTok app on Sunday morning, with outage reports peaking overnight.  Problems range from the app not working properly to total outages and feed issues. This widespread disruption occurs shortly after TikTok finalized a deal to create a new American entity, averting a potential ban.

title: Padma Awards 2026: Dharmendra, Shibu Soren, Mammootty honoured - check full list
content: Veteran actor Dharmendra and former Jharkhand CM Shibu Soren will be honored with Padma Vibhushan and Padma Bhushan posthumously, respectively. India announced 131 Padma Awards for 2026, including five Padma Vibhushan, 13 Padma Bhushan, and 113 Padma Shri, recognizing distinguished service across various fields.

title: Himachal braces for more snow: IMD warns of fresh disturbance; over 800 roads blocked
content: The Met department has warned that weather conditions in Himachal Pradesh may worsen from Monday due to a fresh western disturbance, with heavy snowfall likely in higher reaches. Alerts have been issued as snowfall has already disrupted daily life, shutting over 800 roads and affecting power supply across several districts. Cold wave conditions continue in many parts of the state.

title: 3rd T20I: India demolish New Zealand, chase down 154 in 10 overs to pocket series
content: India crushed New Zealand by eight wickets in the third T20I to seal the series 3-0. Bumrah‚Äôs 3/17, backed by Hardik, Bishnoi, and Rana, restricted New Zealand to 153/9. In reply, Abhishek Sharma‚Äôs 68 off 20 and Suryakumar Yadav‚Äôs 57 off 26 powered India to 155/2 in just 10 overs, completing a commanding win.

title: ‚ÄòDoesn‚Äôt pass the sniff test‚Äô: Netflix rejects Paramount‚Äôs offer for Warner Bros Discovery
content: Netflix co-CEO Greg Peters dismissed Paramount Skydance's $108 billion bid for Warner Bros. Discovery as unrealistic, citing its heavy reliance on debt. He contrasted it with Netflix's more stable $82.7 billion all-cash offer, which is gaining traction with shareholders.  The potential merger faces significant Hollywood and regulatory scrutiny.

title: China‚Äôs top general accused of leaking nuclear secrets to US: Report
content: China's top general, Zhang Youxia, is reportedly under investigation for serious violations, including allegedly leaking nuclear weapons program details to the US and accepting bribes for promotions. The allegations surfaced during a military briefing, with authorities scrutinizing his abuse of authority and oversight of a procurement agency. This investigation highlights Beijing's stringent anti-corruption stance.

title: India rewrite T20I history vs New Zealand in 3rd T20I with fastest-ever‚Ä¶
content: India's batters showcased explosive intent, achieving their fastest-ever team fifty in just 3.1 overs against New Zealand. Abhishek Sharma's blistering 14-ball half-century and Suryakumar Yadav's quickfire fifty powered India to a dominant eight-wicket victory, securing the series. This aggressive batting display signals a new era for Indian T20 cricket.

title: Taylor Swift‚Äôs Kelce Romance Sparks Fears Her Songwriting Is Slowing
content: Taylor Swift recently admitted she once feared happiness could weaken her songwriting as her romance with Travis Kelce deepened. She worried that joy might replace the emotional tension that fueled her lyrics. However, her latest album proved otherwise, showing she can create vibrant, story-driven music even during one of the happiest chapters of her life.

title: Simone Biles vs Chloe Kim: Olympic Stardom, Endorsements, and Net Worth
content: Simone Biles and Chloe Kim both became famous Olympic champions at a young age, but Biles is much richer. Biles has a net worth of approximately $25 million, compared to Kim‚Äôs $10 million. This is because Biles stays in the public eye all year, signs bigger brand deals and gets extra attention through her NFL connection after marriage. Kim‚Äôs earnings are more tied to Olympic seasons, which limits her income compared to Biles.

title: JK Dobbins injury update: Will Broncos RB play in AFC Title game today?
content: Denver faces the AFC Championship without star running back J.K. Dobbins, sidelined by a foot injury.  Despite hopes for a playoff return, Dobbins won't play against the Patriots. Rookie RJ Harvey will lead the backfield, supported by McLaughlin and Badie.  A Super Bowl appearance could see Dobbins return, but for now, the Broncos' depth is tested.

title: Gujarat has its own Wagah: How BSF‚Äôs Beating Retreat differs from Amritsar
content: Gujarat's Nadabet border is transforming into a public tourism hub, offering a unique 'Beating Retreat' ceremony by the BSF. Beyond the evening spectacle, visitors can explore the Sarhad Gatha Museum, pay respects at the Ajeya Prahari Smarak, and experience Seema Darshan for an educational glimpse into border security. This evolving destination aims to engage all ages.

title: Abhishek Sharma scripts history with fastest-ever fifty vs New Zealand, joins elite club
content: Abhishek Sharma etched his name in the record books with a blistering 14-ball fifty, the joint third-fastest in men's T20Is against a Full Member nation. His fearless counter-attack, including a rapid 53-run partnership with Ishan Kishan, set the tone for India's comfortable chase. This historic knock followed a mixed series start, showcasing Sharma's growing reputation as a formidable top-order batter.

title: Winter storm grounds US air travel: Over 10k flights cancelled as snow batters major hubs
content: A severe winter storm has triggered widespread flight cancellations across the US, impacting over 10,000 flights on Sunday alone. Major airports in Dallas, Charlotte, Philadelphia, Atlanta, and New York are experiencing significant disruptions. Airlines are advising passengers to check their status and explore rebooking options, with refunds guaranteed if the trip is no longer desired.

title: Two-child norm and maternity leave: Big win for working mothers in SC
content: The court set aside the decision of the division bench of Madras High Court, which had denied maternity leave to a government school teacher by applying the State‚Äôs two child norm policy, rather than as a right connected to motherhood and reproductive dignity.

title: Will Drake Maye Play Today vs Broncos? Latest Patriots QB Injury Update
content: Drake Maye is healthy and set to start for the New England Patriots in the AFC Championship Game against the Denver Broncos. He has a chance to achieve something the franchise has never done by winning a playoff game in Denver. With the Patriots unbeaten on the road this season, Maye leads a confident team into a hostile, high-altitude environment.

title: President Murmu celebrates citizens‚Äô role in nation-building on Republic Day eve ‚Äì top quotes
content: President Droupadi Murmu, on the Republic Day's eve, lauded India's democratic ideals, national heroes like Netaji Bose, and citizen contributions. She highlighted women's achievements, farmer's role, tribal empowerment, economic growth, and digital India's success. The address underscored collective efforts in building a stronger, self-reliant nation, inspiring national pride and unity.

title: 'Locals pulled me out of vehicle': How seat belt saved Kerala collector's life during car crash
content: Pathanamthitta District Collector Prem Krishnan S narrowly avoided serious harm when his official car overturned after a collision with a speeding private vehicle on the wrong side of the road. The Collector, his security officer, and driver sustained minor injuries, attributing their safety to wearing seat belts.

title: 'Inconsistency is permanent': Samson's golden duck triggers flood of fan reactions
content: Sanju Samson's T20I struggles persisted as he was dismissed for a golden duck on the first ball against New Zealand. His recent lean patch, with scores of 10, 6, and 0, has intensified discussions about India's opening combination. Meanwhile, India's bowlers, led by Ravi Bishnoi and Jasprit Bumrah, restricted New Zealand to 153 for 9.

title: Horrific murder in Mumbai local: New CCTV footage shows moment teacher was stabbed to death
content: A college professor was fatally stabbed on a crowded Mumbai local train after a sudden argument at Malad station. CCTV footage captured the attack and helped police swiftly arrest a daily-wage labourer as the accused. The victim, Alok Kumar Singh, was a mathematics and statistics teacher.

title: 'Outright criminality': BJP leader calls for Mamata's beheading at Bengal rally; TMC hits back
content: The Trinamool Congress has strongly condemned BJP leader Sanjay Das for his derogatory remarks against West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, including calling her a "witch" and advocating for her beheading. The TMC accused the BJP of normalizing misogyny, citing Prime Minister Narendra Modi's past remarks and the act of handing a sword to another BJP leader during the event.

title: Bangladesh exit sends ripples: Pakistan says T20 WC participation uncertain
content: Pakistan's T20 World Cup squad announcement is not a confirmation of participation, with the PCB awaiting government approval. Chairman Mohsin Naqvi stated the board will follow the government's decision regarding the tournament in India and Sri Lanka. The PCB also voiced strong disapproval of the ICC's stance on Bangladesh's exclusion.

title: Macklin Celebrini‚Äôs becomes 12th NHL player with multiple 25-goal teen seasons
content: Macklin Celebrini‚Äôs season continues to keep getting better. At 19, he has reached another rare scoring mark, putting him among a small group of teenage players in NHL history. His growth from last season is clear, and he continues to play with confidence and consistency for the San Jose Sharks.

title: Watch: Hardik Pandya flies to take outrageous catch vs NZ in third T20I
content: Hardik Pandya delivered a spectacular catch in the third T20I against New Zealand. This moment of brilliance provided India with an early advantage. India captain Suryakumar Yadav won the toss and chose to bowl. Harshit Rana took an early wicket. India leads the series 2-0. The team aims to play fearlessly.

title: India Inc cuts volume hiring: Companies go selective on STEM freshers - here's why
content: India Inc is significantly reducing fresh graduate hiring, particularly in STEM fields, as companies prioritise industry-ready talent. This shift sees a focus on smaller, skilled teams and job-ready individuals proficient in cloud platforms, data pipelines, and AI tools.

title: Rohit Sharma and Harmanpreet Kaur to receive Padma Shri
content: Rohit Sharma and Harmanpreet Kaur are set to receive the prestigious Padma Shri for their significant contributions. Sharma's leadership saw India clinch the 2024 T20 World Cup and 2025 Champions Trophy, while Kaur captained the historic Women's World Cup victory on home soil. Their achievements mark a new era for Indian cricket.

title: Budgets have increasingly saved taxpayers lakhs: Will you get more relief this time?
content: The choice between the old and the new income tax regime is an important one and every year, taxpayers carefully calculate the tax liability under each before deciding on which one to opt for.

title: Jason Whitlock sparks controversy with personal claim about Mike Tomlin‚Äôs exit
content: Mike Tomlin‚Äôs sudden exit from the Steelers has led to plenty of questions. The speculation grew louder after Jason Whitlock slammed how the team handled the situation, and podcast host Harold White publicly claimed Tomlin left because of personal issues. Those claims, which include rumors of a pregnancy and a payout, have not been confirmed by Tomlin or the Steelers.

title: Jin, Jiyan, Azadi! Struggles of Iranian women as protests return to streets
content: Iranian women are leading a powerful protest movement, fueled by decades of repression and a fight for basic rights. The slogan 'Woman, Life, Freedom' echoes across the nation, a testament to their courage in demanding bodily autonomy and dignity. Despite facing severe crackdowns and personal risks, their defiance, ignited by Mahsa Amini's death, continues to challenge the state's authority.

title: Mark Tully dies at 90: Born in Kolkata to British parents; how BBC journalist made India his home
content: Renowned journalist Sir Mark Tully, who spent decades reporting from India, has passed away in Delhi at 90. Born in Kolkata to British parents, Tully developed a deep connection with India, covering pivotal events like the Emergency and the assassinations of Indira and Rajiv Gandhi. His insightful books explored India's complexities, earning him prestigious awards and a lasting legacy.

title: Odia singer Abhijit Majumdar passes away: Cause of death and other details
content: The world of Odia music dimmed on January 25, 2026, with the passing of the beloved singer and composer Abhijit Majumdar at AIIMS Bhubaneswar. Enduring a series of severe health crises, including a cardiac arrest that led to refractory septic shock, his legacy is cherished by many. Read on to know more.

title: All aboard for UDAN? Regional connectivity scheme revamp awaits cabinet nod
content: India's regional air connectivity scheme is set for a major overhaul. The government plans to financially support airlines operating on remote routes to cover potential losses. This revamp aims to make flights to hinterland destinations commercially viable. The proposal awaits Cabinet approval. The scheme has already disbursed significant subsidies and invested in airport development.

title: World Cup row: Bangladesh's exit from tournament 'a sad moment for our sport'
content: The World Cricketers' Association expressed disappointment over Bangladesh's withdrawal from the T20 World Cup, calling it a "sad moment" and urging "deep reflection." The ICC replaced Bangladesh with Scotland after the BCB's request to move matches to Sri Lanka was rejected, citing security concerns. The WCA highlighted broader trends of agreements not being honored and a lack of player consultation.

title: Leon Draisaitl opens up on family and NHL absence
content: Leon Draisaitl returned to the Edmonton Oilers after a short personal leave to attend to a family illness in Germany. The star center spoke on Saturday about how the experience taught him to see hockey from a different perspective. With Draisaitl back, Edmonton looks to find consistency heading into the Olympic break.

title: Rupee sinks to 92 against US dollar: What's impacted as currency keeps sliding ‚Äî explained
content: The Indian rupee has hit a historic low against the US dollar, making imports like crude oil and electronics pricier for consumers. While this impacts overseas education and travel costs, it offers a silver lining for exporters by increasing their earnings. Experts advise a balanced approach to manage growth and inflation.

title: 'If India keep doing such circus acts': Ashwin's warning amid selection call
content: Former India all-rounder R Ashwin has urged Team India to stay patient with Sanju Samson despite his twin failures against New Zealand. With Ishan Kishan‚Äôs strong knock increasing competition and Tilak Varma set to return, Ashwin warned against frequent changes, saying it could hurt team balance. He backed Samson‚Äôs attacking intent, while Aakash Chopra called the next match crucial for his future.

title: Puneeth Kerehalli booked for spreading false claims against DG&IGP Saleem
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in! the cybercrime police have booked cow vigilante and right wing activist Puneeth Kerehalli for all charges .

title: President‚Äôs medals conferred on 33 officers from four departments
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: 10,000 Kg Of Explosives, Detonators Seized In Rajasthan On Republic Day Eve
content: Ahead of Republic Day, police in Rajasthan's Nagaur district seized a huge cache of explosives from a farm and arrested a man in connection with the recovery, officials said on Sunday.

title: Mumbai Professor Who Was Stabbed To Death Planned Dinner On Wife's Birthday
content: Alok Kumar Singh, a Mumbai college professor who was allegedly stabbed to death by a commuter following an argument over alighting from a local train at Malad station, had planned dinner with his wife to celebrate her birthday.

title: Shibu Soren Will Forever Remain 'Bharat Ratna': Hemant Soren On Padma Bhushan To Father
content: Jharkhand Chief Minister Hemant Soren on Sunday expressed gratitude to the Centre for conferring the Padma Bhushan on his late father Shibu Soren, as his party, the JMM, demanded a Bharat Ratna for the tribal stalwart.

title: "Unparalleled Bravery": Shaurya Chakra For CRPF Officer Who Killed 10 Manipur Insurgents
content: On the eve of the 77th Republic Day, India's largest paramilitary unit, the Central Reserve Police Force, has been awarded 13 medals for gallantry, including a Shaurya Chakra for an officer who led his team against an insurgent attack in Manipur.

title: Man Who Made Prestige Cooker A Household Name Awarded Padma Shri
content: Late TT Jagannathan, popularly known as 'Kitchen Mogul', of TTK Prestige Group, has been awarded Padma Shri posthumously.

title: Baked Goods Made By Prisoners To Be Served During R-Day Parade In Bengaluru
content: Bakery products prepared by inmates of Bengaluru's Parappana Agrahara Central Prison will be served as snacks at the Republic Day celebrations at the Manekshaw Parade Ground in Karnataka on Monday.

title: Indian-American Doctor Gets Padma Bhushan For Advancing Cancer Treatment
content: Renowned radiation oncologist Dr. Nori Dattatreyudu has been awarded the Padma Bhushan for his outstanding contribution to the field of medicine, as the Ministry of Home Affairs announced the Padma Awards list for 2026 on Sunday.

title: "Aren't You Responsible For Death Of 41 People In Karur?" AIADMK Jabs Vijay
content: Hours after Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK) founder Vijay's "corrupt force" jab at the AIADMK, the party criticised the actor-turned-politician's "narcissistic behaviour" in handling and responding to the stampede at his rally in Karur.

title: "Worshipped God Through Music," Says Tribal Tarpa Player Who Won Padma Shri
content: Tribal wind instrument player, Bhiklya Ladakya Dhinda, named as a recipient of the Padma Shri award in the 'unsung heroes' category, hailed the recognition as blessings of God, whom he worshipped through music since he was a ten-year-old child.

title: "Humbling And Encouraging": Meghalaya Conservationist On Padma Shri
content: Hally War of Meghalaya's East Khashi Hills district on Sunday said he never imagined that his work would be recognised at the national level for him to be selected for the Padma Shri award.

title: Uddhav Thackeray's Party Leader's 'Advice' In Hindsight To MNS
content: The MNS should have informed the Shiv Sena (UBT) about its decision to join hands with Eknath Shinde-led Shiv Sena in the Kalyan Dombivli Municipal Corporation, a leader from the Uddhav Thackeray-led party said on Sunday.

title: 3 Kerala Personalities Among 5 Padma Vibhushan Awardees This Year
content: The Bharat Ratna, India's highest civilian award, was not awarded to any individual this year on the eve of the 77th Republic Day.

title: Man, 60, Dragged Behind Bike After Resisting Robbery
content: A 60-year-old man was brutally assaulted and dragged behind a motorcycle in the Simariya police station area of Rewa district.

title: 'Stuck In Car For Over 24 Hours': Tourists' Manali Nightmare
content: A pristine view of snow-clad mountains and trees was disturbed this week by a long queue of vehicles - all waiting to enter Manali, a popular tourist destination in Himachal Pradesh.

title: After BJP Leader Complains, Bengal Poll Official Suspended Over SIR Lapse
content: The Election Commission of India (ECI) has suspended an Assistant Electoral Registration Officer (AERO) in West Bengal's North 24 Parganas district after serious irregularities were found in the ongoing Special Intensive Revision (SIR).

title: Trinamool, BJP Supporters Clash Near Kolkata, Makeshift Stage Set On Fire
content: Violent clashes broke out between Trinamool Congress and BJP supporters over putting up flags for a political programme in Sakher Bazar in Behala, roughly 11 km from Kolkata, on Sunday.

title: Veteran Cop Vijay Kumar Who Led Veerappan Task Force Awarded Padma Shri
content: K Vijay Kumar, a former CRPF DG who headed the Tamil Nadu Police STF that killed forest brigand Veerappan, has been awarded the Padma Shri.

title: Indore Water Contamination Death Count Rises To 28
content: Rajaram Bourasi, a retired teacher and resident of Bhagirathpura, died on Sunday, raising the death count linked to contaminated drinking water in Indore to 28.

title: Auto Driver Poses As Father, Kidnaps Toddler And Strangles Him To Death
content: An auto driver has been arrested for allegedly kidnapping a one-year-old boy from a creche by posing as his father and later strangling him to death in Haryana's Panchkula, police said on Sunday.

title: 835 Roads Shut In Himachal, Orange Alert Issued For More Snow On Monday
content: As many as 835 roads, including three national highways, remained closed for traffic movement in Himachal Pradesh on Sunday, as a result of heavy snowfall.
